fields.description:
This is in relation to the win.toolbar that shows at the bottom of the window. 

I "think" the issue is the height of the toolbar? Really not sure how else this issue would be resolved without some pretty ugly "hacks".

Please see the attached screenshot that highlights the issue.

attachment.filename: Simulator Screen Shot - iPhone X - 2017-09-18 at 15.02.32.png

fields.summary: iPhone X: Height / Inset of Window Toolbar

comments.body: To be clear, the expected layout would be that it would fill the rounded bottom-part of the screen as well? Will check how it's looking natively.

It is a good question Hans. I have no idea how Apple solved this at a native level. From a logical perspective I would hope that it replicates the behaviour of the navigation bar extending to the top of the iPhone X screen. So yes, hopefully it will fill the rounded bottom part, that would be nice.
This issue has been marked duplicate by Apple and marked closed. I have verified it in Xcode 9.2 beta with iPhone X (11.2 beta), problem is not happening. It looks it is fixed in iOS 11.2 .
Closing as "not our bug". If you disagree, please reopen.
